Public MustInherit Class TextLine Implements IDisposable
public ref class TextLine abstract : IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract class for supporting formatting services to a line of text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLineBreak GetTextLineBreak() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetTextLineBreak () As TextLineBreak

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the line when broken by line breaking process.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the line break.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value is `null` when the line ends at the end of the paragraph.
The text formatter client may pass the return value back as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter.FormatLine%2A> method, which allows the value to be used when formatting the next line within the same paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Height As Double

Docs.summary: Gets the height of a line of text.
Docs.value: The text line height.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property IsTruncated As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IsTruncated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines whether the text line is truncated in the middle of a word.
Docs.value: if the text line is truncated in the middle of a word; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine.IsTruncated%2A> property value is set only when the <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping> property of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextParagraphProperties> is set to <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping.Wrap>, and a single word is wider than the formatting paragraph width. In such situation, <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter> truncates the line in the middle of the word to honor the desired behavior specified by <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping.Wrap> setting.
